result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher W McCants was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any other sentence, with credit for 0 (zero) days time served.
If revoked: Huber release privileges for work ONLY.

miscConds.notes:
*   Court ordered DNA sample to be taken and DNA assessment to be paid.
*   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA) by April 19, 2017. Any remaining balance will be due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment shall be imposed.
*   Obtain and maintain (full-time) employment, work search school, or combination of all.

*   No new criminal violations arising to level of probable cause. 
*   No illegal drugs.

*   Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and costs successfully completes the probation sentence and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.

*   Comply with standard rules of probation.
*   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
*   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant sentenced to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 0 (zero) days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months: If revoked: Huber release privileges for work ONLY:


CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   No new criminal violations arising to level of probable cause. 
     *   No illegal drugs .
     *   Comply with standard rules of probation.
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   Obtain and maintain (full-time) employment, work search school, or.
          combination of all.
     *   Court ordered DNA sample to be taken and DNA assessment to be paid.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA) by April 19, 2017.
          Any remaining balance will be due immediately or an entry of a civil
          judgment shall be imposed.
.
Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and costs successfully completes the probation sentence and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.
.
20 day appeal rights given,
.
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights; received and filed.

Defendant Christopher W McCants in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.   Student Intern Carl Knepel under the student practice rule supervised by Assistant District Attorney Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
BRANCH 31 (HONORABLE JUDGE RIFELJ) FOR BRANCH 04 (HONORABLE JUDGE HANRAHAN)

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Christopher W McCants in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden on behalf of Attorney Robert Hampton.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is seeking to receive a Deferred Prosecution Agreement. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher W McCants in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant to have a TAD assessment.    Case  adjourned to Branch 21 for status on DPA.  Status conference scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher W McCants in court.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant  is not eligible for Public Defender representation.  Court grants the defendant's request for an adjournment to allow for time to retain counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher W McCants in court.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 21.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.  Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 21.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/5/16 @ 1:30p
